content: this is a legal case in slovenia where the supreme court made a decision on september 19 2019 the case involved a real estate property and the division of ownership between the plaintiff and the defendant exspouses the court determined that the plaintiff is entitled to 125 ownership and the defendant is entitled to 775 ownership the supreme court dismissed the application for revision in a court appeal case the laws used in the legal decision were the marriage family relations act and the civil procedure act the outcome of the case is that the core application revision was dismissed the court found that the coowned property is a specific real estate property and granted the plaintiff a land registry permit for 25 ownership the defendant raised questions about the basis for determining the share of coowned property but the supreme court dismissed their application as there were no grounds for review under the civil procedure act

metadata.CASE_ID: Sodba Vrhovnega sodišča RS II Ips 302/2019, 19. 9. 2019
